intro: Solenidiopsis rhombicalla, commonly known as the rhombicallate solenidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant's botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
